thread.title: Riots in Paris after video emerges of ‘police raping black youth with truncheon’
thread.title_full: Riots in Paris after video emerges of ‘police raping black youth with truncheon’

title: Riots in Paris after video emerges of ‘police raping black youth with truncheon’
text:
Getty Images 1 of 8 Avian Influenza Outbreak: On 16 January 2017, a confirmed case of Avian Flu H5N8 was discovered in a commercial turkey unit in East Lindsey, Lincolnshire. 
The alleged incident has led to seething locals taking to the streets surrounding the estate in protest at the police. 
Some have been carrying banners that read “Justice for Theo” while others have used graffiti to express themselves with one phrase claiming: “Police, rapists”. 
At least 3,000 people flocked to the estate last Saturday where a car was set alight and bus shelters were smashed. On Sunday, riot police were sent into the area. GETTY A smashed window in the neighbourhood protests of Aulnay-sous-Bois after protests on Saturday 
Benoit Hamon, the Socialist presidential candidate said: “Police represent the republic that they protect. There is an urgent need to reestablish confidence.” 
A march is planned though the estate today, and there are fears that it too could descend into violence. GETTY Groups holding banners which read "Justice for Theo" 
A local police source said: “We are doing everything possible to maintain public order. Gangs of youths have been attacking us, and setting property on fire every night. The fear is that this violence will escalate.” Related articles
